actor_awards.notes: Received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2001. Inducted into Canada's Walk of Fame in 2002. Made an Officer of the Order of Canada in 2002.

filmography.title: Forbidden Planet
filmography.role_description: The commanding officer of a starship crew sent to investigate a silent colony on a distant planet, encountering a mysterious scientist and an invisible monster.
filmography.plot: A starship crew goes to investigate the silence of a planet's colony only to find two survivors and a deadly secret that one of them has.

filmography.title: Airplane!
filmography.role_description: A deadpan doctor aboard a troubled flight who delivers absurd lines with complete seriousness, launching Nielsen's comedy career.
filmography.plot: A man afraid to fly must ensure that a plane lands safely after the pilots become sick.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy (Film)

filmography.title: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
filmography.role_description: A bumbling, literal-minded police lieutenant who inadvertently causes chaos while trying to foil an assassination plot.
filmography.plot: Incompetent police Lieutenant Frank Drebin must try to foil an attempt to assassinate Queen Elizabeth II.

filmography.title: The Poseidon Adventure
filmography.role_description: The captain of the SS Poseidon who urges caution regarding the ship's stability before disaster strikes.
filmography.plot: A group of passengers struggle to survive and escape when their ocean liner capsizes at sea.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Original Song, Special Achievement Award (Visual Effects)

filmography.title: Creepshow
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, sadistic psychopath who buries his unfaithful wife and her lover up to their necks in sand as the tide comes in.
filmography.plot: An anthology horror film consisting of five terror tales featuring zombies, aliens, and ghosts.

filmography.title: The Naked Gun 2½: The Smell of Fear
filmography.role_description: Drebin returns to save the day, investigating a conspiracy involving energy suppliers and a kidnapped scientist.
filmography.plot: Lieutenant Frank Drebin discovers that his ex-girlfriend's new beau is involved in a plot to kidnap a scientist who advocates for solar energy.

filmography.title: Naked Gun 33⅓: The Final Insult
filmography.role_description: Now retired, Drebin is pulled back into duty to go undercover in a prison to stop a terrorist bombing.
filmography.plot: Frank Drebin comes out of retirement to help Police Squad infiltrate a gang of terrorists planning to detonate a bomb at the Academy Awards.

filmography.title: Prom Night
filmography.role_description: The school principal and father of the siblings targeted by a masked killer seeking revenge.
filmography.plot: At a high school senior prom, a masked killer stalks four teenagers who were responsible for the accidental death of a classmate six years prior.

filmography.title: Ransom!
filmography.role_description: A newspaper reporter covering the kidnapping of a wealthy executive's son.
filmography.plot: When a wealthy man's son is kidnapped, he takes a controversial stand by refusing to pay the ransom on national television.

filmography.title: Tammy and the Bachelor
filmography.role_description: A pilot who crashes near a riverboat and falls in love with the backwoods girl who nurses him back to health.
filmography.plot: A backwoods girl nurses a crashed pilot back to health and later visits him at his plantation home, charming his family.

filmography.title: The Sheepman
filmography.role_description: A man with a secret past who now opposes the new sheep rancher in a cattle town.
filmography.plot: A stranger in a cattle town outwits the locals by hiring the town bum as his ranch foreman and wooing the local beauty.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Story and Screenplay (Film)

filmography.title: Dracula: Dead and Loving It
filmography.role_description: A bumbling, parody version of the legendary vampire in this Mel Brooks comedy.
filmography.plot: Mel Brooks' parody of the classic vampire story and its famous film adaptations.

filmography.title: Spy Hard
filmography.role_description: A secret agent lured out of retirement to stop a madman in this spy genre spoof.
filmography.plot: General Rancor threatens to destroy the world with a missile he hides in his secret base, and only Agent Dick Steele can stop him.

filmography.title: Wrongfully Accused
filmography.role_description: A parody of 'The Fugitive' where a violinist is framed for murder and must clear his name while being chased.
filmography.plot: Ryan Harrison is framed for murder and must prove himself innocent by finding a one-armed, one-legged, one-eyed man.

filmography.title: Scary Movie 3
filmography.role_description: The bumbling President of the United States who deals with an alien invasion.
filmography.plot: Cindy investigates crop circles and video tapes, and helps the President in preventing an alien invasion.
filmography.awards: MTV Movie Award: Win – Best Cameo (Simon Cowell)

filmography.title: Day of the Animals
filmography.role_description: An aggressive advertising executive who succumbs to solar radiation madness and fights a bear.
filmography.plot: The depletion of the ozone layer causes animals at high altitudes to become aggressive and attack humans.

filmography.title: City on Fire
filmography.role_description: The corrupt mayor of a city who must deal with a massive fire disaster.
filmography.plot: A corrupt mayor allows a refinery to be built in the center of the city, which eventually explodes and causes a massive firestorm.

filmography.title: Nuts
filmography.role_description: The client killed by the protagonist, whose death sets off the courtroom drama.
filmography.plot: A high-class call girl accused of murder fights for the right to stand trial rather than be declared mentally incompetent.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Motion Picture - Drama (Film)

filmography.title: Beau Geste
filmography.role_description: A French Foreign Legion officer commanding the fort.
filmography.plot: Two brothers join the French Foreign Legion and find themselves under the command of a sadistic sergeant.

filmography.title: Harlow
filmography.role_description: A studio executive in this biopic of Jean Harlow.
filmography.plot: A biographical film about the life and career of screen siren Jean Harlow.

filmography.title: Night Train to Paris
filmography.role_description: A former OSS agent who gets pulled back into the spy game on a train ride.
filmography.plot: A former secret service agent is tricked into taking a tape recording with vital secrets on a train to Paris.

filmography.title: The Plainsman
filmography.role_description: A historical figure portrayed in this western about Wild Bill Hickok.
filmography.plot: Wild Bill Hickok, Calamity Jane, and Buffalo Bill Cody fight Indians and gunrunners in the Old West.

filmography.title: The Reluctant Astronaut
filmography.role_description: A serious astronaut and superior officer to the bumbling protagonist played by Don Knotts.
filmography.plot: A vertigo-prone carousel operator is hired by NASA as a janitor but is mistakenly sent into space.

filmography.title: Project: Kill
filmography.role_description: A former government assassin who tries to leave the agency but is hunted down.
filmography.plot: A leader of a secret government assassination squad tries to retire but finds himself marked for death by his former employers.

filmography.title: Men with Brooms
filmography.role_description: The father of the protagonist and a curling enthusiast who grows mushrooms in the rocks.
filmography.plot: A curling team from a small Canadian town reunites to win a championship and honor their late coach.
filmography.awards: Canadian Comedy Award: Win – Best Performance by a Male - Film

filmography.title: Repossessed
filmography.role_description: A priest who must perform an exorcism again on a woman possessed by the devil, in this parody of 'The Exorcist'.
filmography.plot: A housewife is possessed by the devil, and the only priest who can save her is now a TV evangelist.
filmography.awards: Razzie Award: Win – Worst Original Song

filmography.title: Music Within
filmography.role_description: A supporting role as the founder of Starkey Hearing Foundation in this biopic.
filmography.plot: The true story of Richard Pimentel, a brilliant public speaker with a troubled past who returns from Vietnam with hearing loss and becomes an advocate for disability rights.
